citations.narrative:
A male guinea pig was outside of his primary enclosure during inspection and in the walkways. The facility representative
said this guinea pig has learned to jump over the dividers and then goes back to his own enclosure for food and water
when it wants and hasn't caused any problems. Ensure that this guinea pig's enclosure is adjusted so that it can't jump
out, as his safety can't be ensured if it is out in the walkways or if it goes in with other guinea pigs that aren't part of his
home enclosure.
***Correct by July 8, 2023.

The licensee has made progress on cleaning out trash from around the food and bedding storage, however there is still
clutter in the area around the food storage in the northwest corner of the barn. While stored bags were observed to lack
any sign of rodent damage in inspection; clutter can allow areas for vermin or rodents to hide and live in which can then
contaminate food/bedding. To protect food and bedding ensure to get the remaining clutter around the food and bedding
storage cleaned out.

The licensee has begun repairs on feeders, however 33 feeders were observed to need repair or replacement; these
feeders had corners or edges that were sharp to the touch. Rough or sharp edges on feeders could hurt guinea pigs and
cannot be cleaned and sanitized. Ensure that affected feeders and enclosure surfaces are maintained smooth and in
good repair to protect the guinea pigs from injury.

The facility has a regular daily and weekly enclosure cleaning routine, however areas in eleven enclosures in inspection
were seen to have excessively soiled, moist material by the water sipper area. Excessive build-up of moist waste material
can cause discomfort and make guinea pigs sick. Ensure that areas of soiled material are cleaned out often enough to
prevent a build-up of material. ***Note: A facility representative began to correct this during inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.25(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
A male guinea pig was outside of his primary enclosure during inspection and in the walkways. The facility representative 
said this guinea pig has learned to jump over the dividers and then goes back to his own enclosure for food and water 
when it wants and hasn't caused any problems. Ensure that this guinea pig's enclosure is adjusted so that it can't jump 
out, as his safety can't be ensured if it is out in the walkways or if it goes in with other guinea pigs that aren't part of his 
home enclosure.  
***Correct by July 8, 2023. 
3.25(c)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
The licensee has made progress on cleaning out trash from around the food and bedding storage, however there is still 
clutter in the area around the food storage in the northwest corner of the barn. While stored bags were observed to lack 
any sign of rodent damage in inspection; clutter can allow areas for vermin or rodents to hide and live in which can then 
contaminate food/bedding. To protect food and bedding ensure to get the remaining clutter around the food and bedding 
storage cleaned out. 
3.28(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
The licensee has begun repairs on feeders, however 33 feeders were observed to need repair or replacement; these 
feeders had corners or edges that were sharp to the touch. Rough or sharp edges on feeders could hurt guinea pigs and 
cannot be cleaned and sanitized. Ensure that affected feeders and enclosure surfaces are maintained smooth and in 
good repair to protect the guinea pigs from injury. 
3.31(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The facility has a regular daily and weekly enclosure cleaning routine, however areas in eleven enclosures in inspection 
were seen to have excessively soiled, moist material by the water sipper area. Excessive build-up of moist waste material

can cause discomfort and make guinea pigs sick. Ensure that areas of soiled material are cleaned out often enough to 
prevent a build-up of material. ***Note: A facility representative began to correct this during inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
